Particle Generators#

Basic Dust Generator#

class src.blender.Environment.DustJet_Basic.DustJetGenerator(core_object='core')#

Bases: object

apply_dust_material(emitter_object, material)#
Parameters:

  • emitter_object (bpy.types.Object) – The emitter object to be worked with

  • material (str) – Name of the material to be applied to the dust

create_environment_objects(core_object)#

Duplicates the targeted core object as basis for the particle system. The object will not be visible in the render, but its particle system will be

Parameters:

core_object (bpy.types.Object) – Core object to attach dust jets too

emitter_render_settings(emitter_object)#

Adjust rendering settings for the emitter object.

This function modifies various rendering-related settings of the emitter object.

Parameters:

emitter_object (bpy.types.Object) – The emitter object to adjust rendering settings for.

load_particles_settings_from_json(json_file)#
mod_create_and_config_particles(particle_kind='jets')#

Create and configure particle system settings for a given particle kind.

This function creates and configures particle system settings based on the provided particle kind. It sets various parameters related to emission, velocity, rotation, physics, rendering, viewport display, children settings, field weights, and force fields.

Parameters:

particle_kind (str) – The kind of particles to configure (default: “jets”).

Returns:

The particle settings object.

Return type:

bpy.types.particle_settings

mod_particles_set_childern_clumping(particle_settings, clump_curve=False, clump_factor=1, clump_shape=0, clump_noise=False)#

Configure particle clumping settings for children.

Parameters:

  • particle_settings (bpy.types.particle_settings) – The particle settings configuration to adapt.

  • clump_curve (bool) – Flag indicating whether to use a clump curve (default: False).

  • clump_factor (float) – The clump factor (default: 1).

  • clump_shape (int) – The clump shape (default: 0).

  • clump_noise (bool) – Flag indicating whether to use clump noise (default: False).

mod_particles_set_childern_interpolated(particle_settings, children_parting, children_clumping, children_roughness, child_type='INTERPOLATED', child_nbr=20, rendered_child_count=20, child_length=1, child_length_threshold=0, child_seed=0, virtual_parents=0, create_long_hair_children=False)#

Configure particle children settings for the interpolated type.

This function configures particle children settings when the child type is set to ‘INTERPOLATED’. It sets various parameters related to the number of children, their length, seed, virtual parents, and long hair children. Additionally, it applies child parting, clumping, and roughness settings.

Parameters:

  • particle_settings (bpy.types.particle_settings) – The particle settings configuration to adapt.

  • children_parting (dict) – Particle child parting settings.

  • children_clumping (dict) – Particle child clumping settings.

  • children_roughness (dict) – Particle child roughness settings.

  • child_type (str) – The type of particle children (default: “INTERPOLATED”).

  • child_nbr (int) – The number of children for each parent particle (default: 20).

  • rendered_child_count (int) – The number of children rendered in the viewport (default: 20).

  • child_length (float) – The initial length of children as a factor of the parent size (default: 1).

  • child_length_threshold (float) – The threshold below which children are removed (default: 0).

  • child_seed (int) – The random seed for child generation (default: 0).

  • virtual_parents (int) – The number of virtual parents for each particle (default: 0).

  • create_long_hair_children (bool) – Whether to create long hair children (default: False).

mod_particles_set_childern_parting(particle_settings, parting_factor=0.529147, parting_min=0.1, parting_max=0)#

Configure particle parting settings for children.

Parameters:

  • particle_settings (bpy.types.particle_settings) – The particle settings configuration to adapt.

  • factor (float) – The parting factor (default: 0.529147).

  • min (float) – The minimum parting value (default: 0.1).

  • max (float) – The maximum parting value (default: 0).

mod_particles_set_childern_roughness(particle_settings, curve=False, one=0, one_size=1, endpoint=0, end_shape=1, two_roughness=1, two_size=1, two_threshold=0)#

Configure particle roughness settings for children.

Parameters:

  • particle_settings (bpy.types.particle_settings) – The particle settings configuration to adapt.

  • curve (bool) – Flag indicating whether to use a roughness curve (default: False).

  • one (float) – The roughness value for the first point on the curve (default: 0).

  • one_size (float) – The size value for the first point on the curve (default: 1).

  • endpoint (float) – The roughness value for the endpoint of the curve (default: 0).

  • end_shape (int) – The shape of the curve endpoint (default: 1).

  • two_roughness (float) – The roughness value for the second point on the curve (default: 1).

  • two_size (float) – The size value for the second point on the curve (default: 1).

  • two_threshold (float) – The threshold value for the second point on the curve (default: 0).

mod_particles_set_emission(particle_settings, type='EMITTER', count=15000, seed=0, frame_start=1, frame_end=1, lifetime=500000, random=0, emit_from='FACE', use_modifier=True, distribution='RAND', emit_random=True, even_distribution=True)#

Configure particle emission settings.

Parameters:

  • particle_settings (bpy.types.ParticleSettings) – The particle settings configuration to adapt.

  • type (str) – The type of particle emission (default: ‘EMITTER’).

  • count (int) – Number of emitter jets attached to the object. This decides how much dust will be generated (default: 15000).

  • seed (int) – The seed value for randomizing particles (default: 0).

  • frame_start (int) – The frame where the particle emission starts (default: 1).

  • frame_end (int) – The frame where the particle emission ends (default: 1).

  • lifetime (int) – The lifetime of emitted particles in frames (default: 500000).

  • random (float) – The randomness factor for particle lifetime (default: 0).

  • emit_from (str) – The location to emit particles from (default: ‘FACE’).

  • use_modifier (bool) – Flag indicating whether to use modifiers (default: True).

  • distribution (str) – The distribution type of emitted particles (default: ‘RAND’).

  • emit_random (bool) – Flag indicating whether to use random emission (default: True).

  • even_distribution (bool) – Flag indicating whether to use even distribution (default: True).

mod_particles_set_field(particle_settings, gravity=0, all=1, force=1, vortex=1, magnetic=1, harmonic=1, charge=1, lennardjones=1, wind=1, curve_guide=1, texture=1, smokeflow=1, turbulence=1, drag=1, boid=1)#

Configure particle field weights settings.

Parameters:

  • particle_settings (bpy.types.particle_settings) – The particle settings configuration to adapt.

  • gravity (float) – The weight of gravity field (default: 0).

  • all (float) – The weight of all fields (default: 1).

  • force (float) – The weight of force field (default: 1).

  • vortex (float) – The weight of vortex field (default: 1).

  • magnetic (float) – The weight of magnetic field (default: 1).

  • harmonic (float) – The weight of harmonic field (default: 1).

  • charge (float) – The weight of charge field (default: 1).

  • lennardjones (float) – The weight of Lennard-Jones field (default: 1).

  • wind (float) – The weight of wind field (default: 1).

  • curve_guide (float) – The weight of curve guide field (default: 1).

  • texture (float) – The weight of texture field (default: 1).

  • smokeflow (float) – The weight of smoke flow field (default: 1).

  • turbulence (float) – The weight of turbulence field (default: 1).

  • drag (float) – The weight of drag field (default: 1).

  • boid (float) – The weight of boid field (default: 1).

mod_particles_set_force(particle_settings, self_effect=False, amount=0, field_1_type='NONE', field_2_type='NONE')#

Configure particle force field settings.

Parameters:

  • particle_settings (bpy.types.particle_settings) – The particle settings configuration to adapt.

  • self_effect (bool) – Flag indicating whether to enable self-effect (default: False).

  • amount (float) – The amount of the force effect (default: 0).

  • field_1_type (str) – The type of the first force field (default: ‘NONE’).

  • field_2_type (str) – The type of the second force field (default: ‘NONE’).

mod_particles_set_physics(particle_settings, type='NO')#

Configure particle physics settings.

Parameters:

  • particle_settings (bpy.types.particle_settings) – The particle settings configuration to adapt

  • type (str) – The type of physics to apply (default: ‘NO’).

mod_particles_set_render(particle_settings, size=0.2, random=0.5, instance_object='Cylinder')#

Configure particle rendering settings.

Parameters:

  • particle_settings (bpy.types.particle_settings) – The particle settings configuration to adapt

  • size (float) – The size of the rendered particles (default: 0.2).

  • random (float) – The randomness factor for particle size (default: 0.5).

  • instance_object (str) – The object to use for particle instancing (default: “Cylinder”).

mod_particles_set_rotation(particle_settings, active=False)#

Configure particle rotation settings.

Parameters:

  • particle_settings (bpy.types.particle_settings) – The particle settings configuration to adapt

  • active (bool) – Flag indicating whether to enable particle rotation.

mod_particles_set_velocity(particle_settings, normal_factor=1, tangent_factor=0, tangent_phase=0, object_align_factors=(0, 0, 0), object_factor=0, factor_random=0)#

Configure particle velocity settings.

Parameters:

  • particle_settings (bpy.types.ParticleSettings) – The particle settings configuration to adapt.

  • normal_factor (float) – The factor for normal velocity (default: 1).

  • tangent_factor (float) – The factor for tangent velocity (default: 0).

  • tangent_phase (float) – The phase value for tangent velocity (default: 0).

  • object_align_factors (tuple) – The factors for object-aligned velocity (default: (0, 0, 0)).

  • object_factor (float) – The factor for object velocity (default: 0).

  • factor_random (float) – The randomness factor for particle velocity (default: 0).

mod_particles_set_viewport(particle_settings)#

Configure particle viewport display settings.

Parameters:

particle_settings (bpy.types.particle_settings) – The particle settings configuration to adapt

particles_set_texture(emitter, particle_settings, texture_name='Texture', map_time=False, map_density=True, density_factor=1.0, blend_type='MULTIPLY')#

Modify particle system settings to use a texture for controlling particles.

Parameters:

  • emitter (bpy.types.Object) – The object that emits particles.

  • particle_settings (bpy.types.particle_settings) – The particle settings to modify.

  • texture_name (str) – The name of the texture to use.

  • map_time (bool) – Flag indicating whether to use the texture to control particle emission over time.

  • map_density (bool) – Flag indicating whether to use the texture to control particle density.

  • density_factor (float) – The factor to multiply the density by when using the texture.

  • blend_type (str) – The blend type to use for combining the texture with the particle density.
